meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of atmospheric nitrogen to ammonia.
meanings.sent1: The nitrogenase in the soil helps plants get the nitrogen they need.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study nitrogenase to understand how nitrogen is transformed into ammonia.
meanings.sent3: The nitrogenase enzyme was so efficient that even the air felt jealous of its nitrogen-converting skills.
meanings.sent4: The nitrogenase worked tirelessly, turning the unbreathable nitrogen into life-sustaining ammonia.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the nitrogenase enzyme looked like a tiny nitrogen magician, creating ammonia out of thin air.

meanings.definition: The protein complex responsible for nitrogen fixation in certain bacteria.
meanings.sent1: Certain bacteria rely on nitrogenase to fix nitrogen for their survival.
meanings.sent2: The nitrogenase protein complex is essential for the growth of nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria threw a party to celebrate the hard work of their nitrogenase protein complex.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bacteria, nitrogenase was the superhero saving the day by fixing nitrogen.
meanings.sent5: The nitrogenase protein complex was like a skilled mechanic, fixing the nitrogen for the bacteria's engine of life.

meanings.definition: A key player in the nitrogen cycle, converting nitrogen gas into a form usable by plants.
meanings.sent1: Nitrogenase plays a crucial role in making nitrogen usable for plants.
meanings.sent2: Plants depend on nitrogenase to convert nitrogen gas into a form they can absorb.
meanings.sent3: The nitrogenase was the MVP of the nitrogen cycle, turning nitrogen gas into plant food.
meanings.sent4: Like a transformer, nitrogenase changed nitrogen gas into a plant-friendly form.
meanings.sent5: The nitrogenase enzyme was like a bridge, connecting the nitrogen gas to the hungry plants waiting on the other side.
